• Record ﬁve features for each noun phrase and model the data as a bipartite graph

with NPs on one side and features on the opposite side.

• Multi-modal edge weights to calculate the similarity between NPs and retrieve all

sentences containing the most similar ones.

• Using the approach speciﬁed in the following research paper.
Smart India Hackathon 2019
• Problem Statement: Inconsistency Detection In Medical Annotation.
• Detected inconsistencies in medical annotation using UMLS’s SNOMED CT

Dataset.

• Implemented front end using HTML, CSS, JS and Flask for integration with

Python backend.

• Used the SNOMED CT dataset in MySQL and accessed it using MySQL Python

Connector and Pandas.

Yes Bank Datathon
• Ranked 1st among 50 teams including industry professionals and won 1st prize

(Rs. 100,000) in Datathon. Link of GitHub Repo.

• Predicted OHLCV for Stock Market using LSTM (Long Short Term Memory).
• LSTM is used as it retain important insights from the previous time steps and pre-

dictions is more accurate than using normal statistics.

Business Analytics and Data Mining Championship
• Worked with SAS to analyse suicide data and measures to curb it.
• Used decision trees to identify the most important factors affecting the student

depression which is directly related to the suicide rates.

• Used second dataset to ﬁnd out which states to focus more on in their policy.
• Won a prize of Rs. 100,000.

PanIIT Machine Learning Challenge
• Ranked 22nd among 113 teams.
• Used Wide Residual Network on Image Classiﬁcation Problem.
• Used Image Data Augmentation for preprocessing.
• Increased the size of training data by 50% to improve the learning.
• Achieved 99.13% accuracy on a test set of 40,000 images.

fasal.ai
• A machine learning based guiding tool, tailor made for growing and maximizing

the proﬁts made by a farmer.
• Input state and city from farmers.
• Used to forecast rainfall, Minimum Selling Price, pH, temperature and production

yield.

• These forecastings fed into XGBoost Classiﬁer predict most suitable crops for

production as output.

Distracted Driver Detection
• Given a dataset of 2D dashboard camera images, classify each driver’s behavior.
• Trained and developed computer vision model, VGG-16 and Wide Residual Net-

work

• Achieved 95% accuracy on the testing data.
• Link: GitHub Repo

Organized Hult Prize NIT Hamirpur OnCampus round as Design Lead. Managed a team of 40 members to orga-
nize the event that had 250+ participants. Hult Prize NIT Hamirpur was among the top 25 OnCampus rounds
conducted all over the world.

Projects
Distracted Driver Detection, NIT Hamirpur
Sep ’20-Jun ’21
The proposed approach is divided into two parts, based on CNN or Convolutional Neural Networks. The first one
detects which activity the driver is currently engaging in, formally named Driver Activity Detection System. The
latter is based on facial feature recognition, which detects the driver’s fatigue level, formally named Driver Fatigue
Detection System. The distraction of the driver is measured independently by both parts.

 ReCOV-101, NIT Hamirpur
Accepted, IoTJ
Computer vision model to detect varying degrees of COVID-19 from full CT scans with 94.9% accuracy, developed
under the research paper titled “Deep Learning Assisted Covid-19 Detection using full CT-scans”.

Online Examination Portal, NIT Hamirpur
Sep ’19–Dec ’19
An online examination portal where teachers can add papers and conduct tests at their convenience. Students
have access to their personal dashboard which displays active tests, previous test records and performance
graphs. Front-end was developed using bootstrap and JavaScript. The web-application was complete with full
SQL database support and was served using python Flask.

Energy Demand Forecasting, Business Analytics and Data Mining Championship 2019
Case Study: Energy Demand Forecasting for Power Industry.
Data: Historical demand data at 30 minutes intervals for 2004, 2005 & 2006, at station level and overall. Holiday
Indicator for 2004, 2005, and 2006. Weather data from 2004 to 2006.

NER Corpus Expansion, ezDI, Inc.

Yes Bank Datathon, Yes Bank, IIT Bombay
Dec ’18
Ranked 1st among 50 teams including industry professionals and won 1st prize in Datathon. Predicted OHLCV
